articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in B (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in B (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 13th chord in B, also known as the C shape, is a sophisticated and rich-sounding chord that adds color and depth to music compositions. It is a complex chord that can provide a jazzy or soulful feel, commonly used in jazz, R&B, and soul music genres. 

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (B)
- Major 3rd (D#)
- Perfect 5th (F#)
- Dominant 7th (A)
- Major 9th (C#)
- Perfect 11th (E)
- Major 13th (G#)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 13th chord in B (C shape) is often used in genres like jazz, R&B, and soul due to its lush and jazzy sound. It can add a sense of sophistication, harmony, and complexity to musical pieces. The chord has an elegant and luxurious flavor when incorporated into music, creating a smooth and rich texture.

## Songs Featuring the Chord
1. **"Autumn Leaves"** by Nat King Cole - This jazz standard prominently features variations of the 13th chord, showcasing its versatility and captivating sound.
2. **"I Say a Little Prayer"** by Aretha Franklin - This soulful classic incorporates the 13th chord in a way that enhances the emotional depth and melodic richness of the song.
3. **"So What"** by Miles Davis - A well-known jazz composition that showcases the 13th chord in B (C shape) within its harmonic structure, adding depth and complexity to the piece.
